text: Urban-type settlement, abbreviated: ; , abbreviated: ; ; ; ; . is a name for a semi-urban settlement (suburb) used in many Eastern European countries. The name was historically used in Bulgaria, Poland, and the Soviet Union. Today, it is used in many post-Soviet states: Azerbaijan, Belarus, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Mongolia,Russia, Tajikistan, Turkmenistan, and Uzbekistan. == Related articles == * Administrative divisions of Georgia (country) * Political divisions of Russia * Regions of Belarus * Subdivisions of Kyrgyzstan == Notes == Category:Types of settlements
title: Urban-type settlement
